channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: 188 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 1 in the community and 12 imported
item.description:
August 10, 2020 3:25 PM

SINGAPORE - There were 188 new coronavirus cases confirmed as of Monday noon (Aug 10), taking Singapore's total to 55,292.

item.title: Cycling path network in Singapore to treble by 2030
item.description:
August 10, 2020 3:05 PM

SINGAPORE - Urban Redevelopment Authority chief executive Lim Eng Hwee has been cycling to work since he was chief planner for the authority some 10 years ago.

item.title: Bicycle sales gets boost from Covid-19 pandemic, as more turn to cycling for leisure, transport
item.description:
August 10, 2020 3:04 PM

SINGAPORE - Thanks partly to the pandemic, cycling is fast gaining popularity - not only as a leisure activity, but also as a mode of transport.

item.title: Lush greenery and sustainable features in Tengah's new Park district
item.description:
August 10, 2020 1:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Rainforest-themed children's playgrounds, a green lung called Central Park and a 1.5km-long rainforest walk that connects various housing projects.

item.title: First batch of BTO flats in Park district in Singapore's newest town Tengah set for launch
item.description:
August 10, 2020 1:00 PM

The new district will have an estimated 7,200 flats when completed.

item.title: Electric-car sharing service BlueSG reaches its one millionth rental
item.description:
August 10, 2020 12:29 PM

SINGAPORE - Electric-car sharing service, BlueSG, announced on Monday (Aug 10) that it has reached its one millionth rental since launching its car-sharing programme in 2017.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 10
item.description:
August 10, 2020 8:11 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Monday, Aug 10.

item.title: When NDP went to the heartland: How S'poreans marked nation's 55th birthday
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans across the island came out to wave to the tanks and watch the flag fly-past and fireworks display.

item.title: NDP 2020: Sharing the Singapore story
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

REPORTERS

item.title: A new baby in their lives on nation's 55th birthday
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

As Singaporeans across the island rang in the nation's 55th birthday yesterday, a couple welcomed a new baby into their lives.

item.title: Motion in Action
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

WISH FOR SINGAPORE

item.title: NDP 2020: Let's show the world Singaporeans will stay united, says PM Lee Hsien Loong
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

The determination of Singaporeans to stand firm together in the face of adversity since the nation's birth is why he is confident the Republic will get through the Covid-19 pandemic, as it has previous crises, Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said yesterday.

item.title: Apart, but in one voice for Anthem Moment
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

For 1½ minutes yesterday morning, Singaporeans at different locations across the island came together to sing Majulah Singapura in unison.

item.title: NS Square to be focus of new Marina Bay downtown
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

A permanent space for large-scale events that will also pay tribute to Singapore's national servicemen will take the place of the popular Marina Bay floating platform and will be the central focus of the new downtown area, said Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong in his National Day message yesterday.

item.title: Help, the pandemic is driving me crazy
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

During the two-month circuit breaker period from April 7, most people in Singapore stayed home as much as possible to fight Covid-19.

item.title: NDP 2020: Six patrol vessels with thermal cameras and drones to help keep S'pore's waters safe
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Six patrol vessels equipped with multi-sensor marine thermal cameras, chemical gas detectors and drones were launched yesterday as part of the Republic's thrust to keep its waters safe.

item.title: Heart failure not a death sentence
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

When I saw Mr Bernard Lim (not his real name) in May this year, he was walking very slowly and looked extremely fatigued.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singaporean woman, 57, is sole community case
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

There were 175 new coronavirus cases confirmed yesterday, taking Singapore's total to 55,104, said the Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday.

item.title: NDP 2020: Standing masked but not muted
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

The country struck a tone of defiance in the face of the coronavirus outbreak as it turned 55 yesterday.

item.title: Police report filed against Crisis Centre after charity was barred from raising funds last year
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Social and Family Development said it had investigated the group's fund-raising appeals and found possible criminal misconduct.

item.title: NDP 2020: Singapore will emerge more united from shared ordeal, says PM Lee Hsien Loong
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Facing the Covid-19 crisis together could define this generation of Singaporeans, said PM Lee in his National Day message.

item.title: NDP 2020: Celebrating front-line fighters
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Front-line workers who have been toiling day in and day out since the coronavirus outbreak began here in January were honoured by a grateful nation yesterday.

item.title: 6,000 SIA Group staff take no-pay leave, so firm can cope with crisis due to Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 1,700 employees have also signed up for volunteer positions and jobs in external organisations.

item.title: NDP 2020: Special meaning behind President's brooch, scarf
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Sharp-eyed Singaporeans would have spotted the unique designs on the red-and-white silk cotton scarf and colourful enamel brooch that President Halimah Yacob donned at the Padang parade yesterday morning.

item.title: Physical Meet-the-People Sessions can resume with crowd size capped at 50
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Meet-the-People Sessions (MPS) will be allowed to resume from today, with precautions taken such as a cap of 50 people or fewer on the crowd size, the National Environment Agency said.

item.title: NDP 2020: A show of unity and strength
item.description:
August 10, 2020 5:00 AM

Nine-month-old Chloe Swah turned towards the skies, her attention drawn by the roar of six F-15 fighter jets tearing past above her home in Kovan.
